title: Helly's theorem
summary: Helly's theorem is a basic result in discrete geometry on the intersection of convex sets. It was discovered by Eduard Helly in 1913,[1] but not published by him until 1923, by which time alternative proofs by Radon (1921) and KÃ¶nig (1922) had already appeared. Helly's theorem gave rise to the notion of a Helly family.
